Ben Ward (born 10 December 1988) is an English former professional darts player who competed in Professional Darts Corporation tournaments.
Darts career
Ward competed on the PDC Challenge Tour in 2013 and won two events to finish second in the Order of Merit behind Ross Smith. He was awarded a place in the preliminary round of the 2014 PDC World Championship, where he lost 4–1 to Zoran Lerchbacher.
In 2014, Ward qualified for his first UK Open but was defeated 5–0 by Steve Maish in the second round. He reached the quarter-finals of a PDC ProTour event for the first time at the seventh Players Championship but lost 6–1 to Keegan Brown.
Ward played in the 2015 UK Open, defeating Jason Lovett 5–2 in the preliminary round but losing 5–1 to Mark Cox in the first round. His ranking plunged to number 102 after failing to advance beyond the last 64 in any event during the year.
